name: RouteParser.QueryString
comment:
Tools for query string parsing and extraction

@docs QueryString, parse

aliases.name: QueryString
aliases.comment: A parsed query string is a Dict of param names to param value list.

values.name: parse
values.comment: Parse a query string. Parsed string must include the leading "?" char.

name: RouteParser

aliases.name: Router
aliases.comment: A router is composed of a route parser, and a path generator.
aliases.type: { fromPath : String -> Maybe.Maybe route, toPath : route -> String }

types.name: Param
types.comment: A param parser in a route

values.name: customParam
values.comment: Build a custom param extractor from a parser instance

values.name: dyn1
values.comment:
Matcher for a path with one dynamic param.

    type Route = Topic Int
    matchers = [ dyn1 Topic "/topic/" int "/edit" ]

    match matchers "/topic/1/edit" == Just (Topic 1)
values.type: (a -> route) -> String -> RouteParser.Param a -> String -> RouteParser.Matcher route

values.name: dyn2
values.comment:
Matcher for a path with two dynamic params.

    type Route = SubTopic Int Int
    matchers = [ dyn2 SubTopic "/topic/" int "/" int "" ]

    match matchers "/topic/1/2" == Just (SubTopic 1 2)
values.type: (a -> b -> route) -> String -> RouteParser.Param a -> String -> RouteParser.Param b -> String -> RouteParser.Matcher route

values.name: dyn3
values.comment:
Matcher for a path with three dynamic params.

    type Route = Something String String String
    matchers = [ dyn3 Something "/some/" string "/thing/" string "/here/" string "" ]

    match matchers "/some/cool/thing/must-be/here/i-guess" == Just (Something "cool" "must-be" "i-guess")
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> route) -> String -> RouteParser.Param a -> String -> RouteParser.Param b -> String -> RouteParser.Param c -> String -> RouteParser.Matcher route

values.name: mapMatcher
values.comment: Map the result of the match

values.name: mapMatchers
values.comment:
map a list of matchers from a route type to another route type.
Useful for subrouting, like delegating one of the routes to another type :

    -- global routing:

    type Route = Home | Admin AdminRoute

    matchers =
      [ static Home "/" ] ++ (mapMatchers Admin adminMatchers)

    -- can be delegated to a component without knowdedge of global routing:

    type AdminRoute = Dashboard | Users

    adminMatchers =
      [ static Dashboard "/admin", static Users "/users" ]

values.name: match
values.comment: Given a list of matchers and a path, return the first successful match of the path.

values.name: parserMatcher
values.comment: Build a route from a Parser instance

values.name: rawMatcher
values.comment: Build a route from a raw matcher function

values.name: router
values.comment:
Full-featured router. A record with two properties:

* `fromPath` to maybe get the route from a path,
* `toPath`to build the path from the route, typically for links in the views.

values.name: static
values.comment:
Matcher for a static path.

    type Route = About
    matchers = [ static About "/about" ]

    match matchers "/about" == Just About
